1.text: The kingâ€™s heart is in the hand of the LORD as the watercourses: he turneth it whithersoever he will.

2.text: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes: but the LORD weigheth the hearts.

3.text: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.

4.text: An high look, and a proud heart, even the lamp of the wicked, is sin.

5.text: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness: but every one that is hasty hasteth only to want.

6.text: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vapour driven to and fro; they that seek them seek death.

7.text: The violence of the wicked shall sweep them away; because they refuse to do judgment.

8.text: The way of him that is laden with guilt is exceeding crooked: but as for the pure, his work is right.

9.text: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a contentious woman in a wide house.

10.text: The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.

11.text: When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.

12.text: The righteous man considereth the house of the wicked; how the wicked are overthrown to their ruin.

13.text: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry, but shall not be heard.

14.text: A gift in secret pacifieth anger, and a present in the bosom strong wrath.

15.text: It is joy to the righteous to do judgment; but it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.

16.text: The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding shall rest in the congregation of the dead.

17.text: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.

18.text: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; and the treacherous cometh in the stead of the upright.

19.text: It is better to dwell in a desert land, than with a contentious and fretful woman.

20.text: There is precious treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man swalloweth it up.

21.text: He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

22.text: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and bringeth down the strength of the confidence thereof.

23.text: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.

24.text: The proud and haughty man, scorner is his name, he worketh in the arrogance of pride.

25.text: The desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour.

26.text: There is that coveteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giveth and withholdeth not.

27.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination: how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind!

28.text: A false witness shall perish: but the man that heareth shall speak unchallenged.

29.text: A wicked man hardeneth his face: but as for the upright, he ordereth his ways.

30.text: There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD.

31.text: The horse is prepared against the day of battle: but victory is of the LORD,
